subject: RE: [junit] class being initialized for each test
msgSnippet: Thanks for the help and quick response everyone (especially Joi Ellis and Vladimir Bossicard).
messageBody:
Thanks for the help and quick response everyone (especially Joi Ellis and
Vladimir Bossicard).

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Joi Ellis [mailto:joi@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 15, 2001 12:11 PM
> To: Junit
> Subject: Re: [junit] class being initialized for each test
>
>
> On Tue, 15 May 2001, [iso-8859-1] Mike Lépine wrote:
>
> > One of my peers is running a JUnit test that he wrote and it
> appears that
> > JUnit is initializing his test class for each test. He invokes the
> > TestRunner in the main method of the class. Is this standard or
> something
> > we're doing wrong.
>
> As I understand it, JUnit inspects your test class to get its list of
> methods, and its default constructor. It then instantiates one copy
> of the test class for each test method and stores that in a vector of
> tests.
>
> So yes, JUnit will initialize the test class and then run setup()
> for every individual test method on the class. This is how it keeps
> the fixture clean for each test. (The code which does this is in
> the junit.framework.TestSuite contructor and
> junit.framework.TestSuite.addTestMethod().
>
> If you have initialization which must execute at most once for the
> entire set of methods, see the junit.extensions.TestSetup class.
> That's what I use, anyway.
>
